prompt: Start here to verify your Qualifying APM Participant (QP) status.
Ok, let’s see if you qualify as a Partial QP.
Let's check your MIPS APM eligibility.
Let's check your MIPS APM eligibility.
Are you in an Advanced APM (includes All-Payer and Other-Payer)?
Do you receive at least 50% of your Medicare Part B payments OR see at least 35% of Medicare patients through an Advanced APM entity at one of the snapshots?
Do 75% of the practices use a certified EHR within the Advance APM?
Do you receive at least 40% of your Medicare Part B payments OR see at least 25% of Medicare patients through an Advanced APM entity at one of the snapshots?
Will you report to MIPS?

Are you a clinician or group participating in an Advanced APM that’s also a MIPS APM at or below the Low Volume Threshold (LVT) of $90,000 in covered professional services under the Medicare Physician Fee Schedule (PFS), or furnishing covered professional services to less than or equal to 200 beneficiaries?
Are you an eligible individual clinician type on Medicaid Part B claims, and not in an Advanced APM?
Were you enrolled in Medicare before January 2020?
Are you associated with a Practice that exceeds the Low-Volume Threshold (LVT)?

In both 12-month segments of MIPS Determination, did you bill more than $90,000 for Part B covered professional services, and see more than 200 Part B patients, and; provide more than 200 covered professional services to Part B patients or LVT?
Do you exceed at least 1 (but not all 3) of the Low-Volume Threshold (LVT) at the group level?
Do you exceed 1-2 of the three Low-Volume Thresholds (LVT) as an individual?
You are a Qualifying APM Participant (QP).
You are a Partial Qualifying APM Participant (Partial QP).
You are a Partial Qualifying APM Participant (Partial QP; Non-reporting).
You are a MIPS APM Participant.
You are MIPS Eligible as an Individual.
You are Opt-In Eligible as an Individual.
You are Opt-In Eligible as an Group.
You not eligible
If you’re not one of these clinician types, you’re exempt from reporting.
You do not meet the eligibility requirements.
If you’re MIPS eligible in your Group or Virtual Group, you’ll receive a score and payment adjustment based on group reporting.
